intro: Denmoza strausii var. luteispina, commonly known as the yellow-spined denmoza, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow spines along the stem and leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is known for its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of pink and purple. It has a woody stem and produces capsule fruits containing several seeds. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
